Senior Residents are experienced students who play a vital role in the pastoral care of new students who live in the College Halls of Residence. Senior Residents help students to settle into life at College, enabling new students to benefit from their knowledge of the College and local area (e.g. who to see, where places are, what to visit etc). Senior Residents provide a reassuring presence to first year students.

Senior Residents can assist students in the settling of disputes, the encouragement of good behaviour and the discouragement of inappropriate behaviour. Senior Residents have the authority to give instructions to students and make requests of other students (e.g. regarding noise levels). In doing this, Senior Residents are acting on behalf of the Hall community as the first, informal level of pastoral care.

Where appropriate, Senior Residents link up with Security and Student Support staff to ensure that students receive appropriate pastoral care. Senior Residents report to the Colleges Student Support department. Students can find out more about the Senior Resident role by contacting Judith Atkinson in the Student Support Central Office (Room AG09), (ext. 196), Email:

If you are living in College accommodation, you will have the opportunity to meet your Senior Resident at the beginning of your first term. At the start of the academic year a list of the Senior Residents assigned to individual Halls of Residence can be found on the Student Support website.
